alert.note: Alert for Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:26PM EDT until June 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON...NORTHWESTERN HERTFORD...SOUTHEASTERN GREENSVILLE...SOUTHWESTERN SOUTHAMPTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL SUSSEX COUNTIES... At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Green Plain, or 9 miles northwest of Boykins, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Boykins and Newsoms around 645 PM EDT. Murfreesboro, Chowan University and Conway around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Milwaukee, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Mapleton, Bryants Corner, Worrell, Sunbeam, Creeksville, Bartonsville and Riverdale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
